definition: (idiom) to use methods in line with local circumstances
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Is a clear mandate and objectives, according to its work.
sentences.chinese: 二是明确任务和目标，因地制宜地开展工作。

sentences.english: There are, however, wide variations in the specifics, with three main approaches taken.
sentences.chinese: 然而，各国因地制宜，主要采取的方法有三种。

sentences.english: In accordance with urban waterlogging situation, controlment measures should be taken according to local conditions.
sentences.chinese: 根据城市内涝的情况，应因地制宜地采取防治措施。

sentences.english: As a result, he says, prevention efforts must fit with local needs.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他说，预防自杀的工作应该因地制宜的开展。

definition: (idiom) to use methods appropriate to the current situation
to take advantage of the new situation (idiom)/to make the best of new opportunities
an overall plan taking into account all factors
lit. measure the body then tailor the suit (idiom); fig. to act according to actual circumstances/To live within one's means.
to foster strengths and avoid weaknesses (idiom)/to play to one's strengths
land use plan (official P.R.C. government term)
pinyin: tu3 di4 li4 yong4 gui1 hua4
